parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.5</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return the damage value of an object. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[damage]] object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - the returned number in range (healthy) 0..1 (dead). </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
	  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[?]] (([[damage]] [[player]]) [[a_greater_b|>]] 0.1) : [[player]] [[groupChat]] "I'm hurt! Medic!"</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] (([[damage]] [[player]]) [[a_greater_b|>]] 0.1) [[then]] {
    [[player]] [[groupChat]] "I'm hurt! Medic!";
};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _health = (1 - [[damage]] [[player]]) * 100; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Health in % from 0 to 100</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setDamage]], [[setHit]], [[getHit]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]], [[getHitPointDamage]], [[setHitPointDamage]], [[Arma 3: Event Handlers#HandleDamage|"HandleDamage" Event Handler]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

[[Category:Scripting Commands Take On Helicopters|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 13, 2015 - 20:20 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The returned value depends on the couple target/ammo fired. This value has no correlation with the sum of all hitpoints damage status and the effective status of the object. Firing bullets on cars often lead to weird results. For example: [[damage]] returns zero while a Hunter is fired at will with an .50 HMG! Hunter can be almost destroyed with zero damage for this function. If you script, use instead the [[getHitPointDamage]] command.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
